page.title: 10WATER SUPPLY
page.content: There are 3 reservoirs in the Deeply Vale area. The largest is Ashworth Reservoir. The other main reservoir is Deeply Hill and its sub resrvoir. Near to Deeply Hill reservoir is an old ruined mill. Ashworth Reservoir is situated near to the Cheesden Lumb Mill. When looking at it today from the western overflow side the two buildings can be seen. In dry weather it is possible to walk on the large overflow steps. These are about 10 feet high. At the bottom of the overflow is a stagnant pool. This is a death trap for local sheep. If they fall in they cannot climb up the steep banks.
